articles.title: Congratulations to PM of Democratic Congo
articles.content:
Congratulations to PM of Democratic Congo 
   Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a congratulatory message to Antoine Gizenga Fundji upon his appointment as Prime Minister of Democratic Congo.
 Expressing belief that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the mutual interests, the message wished him success in his work.

Opening of Medical Market Assailed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Opening of Medical Market Assailed in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- More than 7,000 doctors under the south Korean Doctors Association called a rally in front of the "government" building on Jan. 10, protesting against the negotiations on conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. "Free Trade Agreement", according to south Korea's KBS.
 The ralliers charged that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities discussed the matter of opening the medical market in the field of traditional medicine at the 5th round of negotiations on concluding the FTA in Dec. last year.    
 In case the medical market is opened, the south Korean people's health will be exposed to threat of American doctors, they said, demanding an immediate halt to such move.

11th Kimjongilia Festival to Be Held
articles.content:
11th Kimjongilia Festival to Be Held
   Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- The 11th Kimjongilia Festival will be held here on the occasion of the February holiday, birthday of Kim Jong Il.
 The festival is to take place at the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition in mid-February.    
 Attending it will be organs of armed forces, commissions and ministries of the Cabinet, national institutions and institutions in the city of Pyongyang, servicepersons, working people and school youth and children. It will be also participated in by overseas compatriots' organizations and individual compatriots, embassies of different countries and missions of international organizations here, friendship and social organizations in various countries and foreign friends.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Jordanian King
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Jordanian King
   Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Abdullah II, King of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, on the occasion of the New Year.
 The gift was conveyed to an official of the DPRK embassy in China on Wednesday.

Japan's Suppression of Chongryon Lambasted in S. Korea
articles.content:
Japan's Suppression of Chongryon Lambasted in S. Korea
   Pyongyang, January 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century reportedly made public a statement titled "We strongly denounce the Japanese authorities' suppression of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), an act of violating human rights and inciting national discrimination" on Jan. 10. 
 Noting that the Japanese reactionaries are now getting evermore undisguised in suppression of Chongryon and Korean residents in Japan and encroachment upon their human rights, the statement strongly condemned the reckless acts of the Japanese ultra-right conservatives.    
 The above-said crackdown is intended to disunite the Korean community in Japan and build up a spiritual basis for staging a comeback to the Korean Peninsula, the statement said. It stressed that the federation will wage a vigorous struggle to reveal the seriousness and true nature of the Japanese authorities' crackdown upon Chongryon and stir up the public opinion against it.
